thread.title: Mustangs, Lions split Oct. 8 contests as regular season winds down
thread.title_full: Mustangs, Lions split Oct. 8 contests as regular season winds down

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mustangs, Lions split Oct. 8 contests as regular season winds down
text:
Mustangs, Lions split Oct. 8 contests as regular season winds down Waldo County squads to host quarterfinal playoff games, likely Oct. 20 By Staff | Oct 09, 2015 
It is no mystery that the Belfast and Mount View high school field hockey teams are, as usual, playoff-bound, the only question that remains is where will they be slotted? 
That question will not be answered until next week, though both squads will undoubtedly host quarterfinal playoff games once the postseason begins on Saturday, Oct. 17. 
In regular-season action on Thursday, Oct. 8, the Lions came up short in a 2-1 loss to Gardiner, while the Mustangs galloped to a 7-0 win over Maranacook of Readfield. 
Belfast will close the regular season on Tuesday, Oct. 13 at Erskine Academy, while Mount View will close the regular season on the same day in a potential regional final preview at Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield, currently the top seed in the region. 
The prelim playoff round is scheduled to begin on Saturday, Oct. 17, while the quarterfinal round will reportedly follow on Tuesday, Oct. 20. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Mount View 7, Maranacook 0 
At Thorndike Oct. 8, the Mustangs continued to stampede toward the Class C North playoffs as they blanked the Black Bears. 
Leading the Mount View offense was Reanna Boulay (2 goals, assist), McKenna Gibbs (assist), Megan Mikel (4 goals, assist), Risa Fox (goal, assist) and Krysta Porter (assist). 
Alexis Bowman made two saves on two shots in the cage for the Mustangs, while Kaitlyn Mason made 20 saves on 28 shots in goal for the Black Bears. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class C North, Mount View (9-4, 87.3469 points) is second, while Maine Central Institute (9-3, 89.0306 points) is first in the 11-team region. The top eight teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Gardiner 2, Belfast 1 
At Belfast Oct. 8, the Lions were nipped by the Tigers in a match that featured two of the Kennebec Valley Athletic Conference Class B's top-ranked squads. Gardiner led 1-0 at halftime. 
Alicia Gaiero scored the lone goal for Belfast, off an assist by Kylie Nelson, while Bri Brochu and Amanda Cameron scored for Gardiner, off assists by Maddy Walker and Hailey Lovely. 
Morgan Fernald made one save on three shots in the cage for the Lions, while Kaylia Mansir made one save on two shots in goal for the Tigers. Belfast held a 7-2 edge in penalty corners. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (10-3, 103.4694 points) is fourth, while Gardiner (11-2, 116.0204 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs.
